page.title: 08Education in Huntley
page.content: Huntley C of E (Aided) Primary School was built in 1874-5 by the Rector of Huntley Rev. H.E. Miles and first maintained by him. The school building is adjacent to the church and in 1985 has 85 pupils arranged in three classes. The {population}of Huntley grew rapidly in the early 70's and the school had to be enlarged. One terrapin was placed at the front of the school in the 70's and a 2nd. has been erected since 1980 between the school building and the church. At 11 years of age all children in Huntley transfer to an 11-18 Comprehensive School at{Newent}which in 1985 has over 1200 pupils.
